title: Aadhaar, voter ID & ration cards can’t be considered for SIR: EC
content: The Election Commission of India disagreed with the Supreme Court's view on using Aadhaar, voter ID, and ration cards for Bihar's electoral roll Special Summary Revision. EC stated these documents are unreliable. Aadhaar is just an identity proof. Many fake ration cards exist. Using current voter cards would defeat the purpose of the special drive.

title: Bihar hospital shooting: 2 murder suspects shot in encounter with cops; 7 held so far
content: Two suspects in the daylight murder of gangster Chandan Mishra at a Patna hospital were injured in a police encounter in Arrah. The suspects were part of a group that fatally shot Mishra, who was out on parole for surgery. Following arrests in Kolkata, police traced the gang, leading to the encounter and ongoing interrogations of ten suspects.

title: As Dhankhar resigns, NDA in huddle over VP post; who’s in the running?
content: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned on Monday, citing health reasons, creating a vacancy for a new vice-president. His resignation surprised the BJP-led NDA, which will now consider potential candidates. The BJP is expected to select a nominee from a pool of governors, senior leaders, or Union ministers. Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh is among those being considered.

title: 'People were screaming, running': Eyewitnesses recall Bangladesh air crash horror
content: A Bangladesh Air Force fighter jet crashed into the Milestone School and College in Dhaka, resulting in a devastating scene of fire and panic. The accident claimed the lives of at least 25 people, including students and the pilot, and left over 170 injured.

title: New twist! Pakistan refuse to share points, say 'India backed out'
content: The World Champions of Legends (WCL) announced the cancellation of the highly anticipated India-Pakistan match at Edgbaston, citing their inability to conduct the game. The decision follows the refusal of several Indian players, including Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan, to participate due to heightened geo-political tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Elon Musk admits to 'living in denial'
content: Elon Musk, acknowledging his past resistance to AI, has declared “game on,” signaling a more aggressive approach to the technology. This shift follows his earlier warnings about AI's potential dangers. Musk's renewed focus is evident through xAI, his startup competing with industry giants.

title: Buried beneath new tiles: Man’s body found after switched off phone raises alarm
content: In Nalasopara (east), a shocking discovery unfolded as the body of 32-year-old Vijay Chauhan was found buried within his own home, prompting a police investigation. Suspicion arose when Chauhan's brothers noticed newly laid floor tiles and the unexplained absence of his wife, Chaman Devi.

title: Trump admin releases MLK Jr., Hillary probe files; what do they reveal?
content: The Trump administration has released thousands of documents related to the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. in 1968 and Hillary Clinton's email controversy. The King files detail the investigation into James Earl Ray and international intelligence cooperation. The Clinton documents reveal alleged FBI negligence in investigating her handling of classified information, raising questions about political influence.

title: 'Stabbed 14 times': Jaipur man butchered in public, accused posts 'revenge' boast
content: Jaipur witnessed widespread protests after the brutal murder of Vipin Kumar, allegedly by Mohammad Anas, disrupting traffic on the Jaipur-Agra highway. Accused Anas, a known history-sheeter, was arrested after attempting to seize a police officer's weapon and was shot in the leg.

title: H-1B visa data reveals how much Nike pays its Software engineers in the US
content: Nike's H-1B visa data reveals software engineer salaries in the US, ranging from $139,845 to $301,378 based on specialization. The company's investment in tech roles reflects its digital transformation. While Nike sponsors roles in data, product, and design, primarily in Beaverton, Oregon, it's also undergoing restructuring, including tech division job cuts and outsourcing to third-party vendors.

title: 'Sledging fired up Virat Kohli, but it rattled Shubman Gill'
content: Sanjay Manjrekar supports Shubman Gill to rebound in the fourth Test against England despite India trailing 1-2. Manjrekar acknowledged Gill's leadership while noting his aggression differs from Virat Kohli's. He observed Gill's frustration during the Lord's Test and how sledging might have affected his batting.

title: 2006 Mumbai train blasts: Torture of accused barbaric, inhuman, says HC
content: The Bombay High Court acquitted all accused in the train blasts case, deeming confessions extracted by the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) as inadmissible due to "barbaric and inhuman" torture. Accusations included severe physical abuse and psychological coercion, leading the court to question the validity of the confessions. The court also highlighted procedural lapses in invoking MCOCA, further undermining the prosecution's case.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Kamboj has control, and bowling brain like Zaheer, Bumrah' - Ashwin
content: Haryana seamer Anshul Kamboj has been drafted into India's Test team as cover for injured Arshdeep Singh and Akash Deep. R Ashwin believes Kamboj's first-class form and ability to bowl long spells make him a valuable asset in England. Ashwin also praises Kamboj's understanding and execution of plans, comparing him to Zaheer Khan and Jasprit Bumrah.

title: Why Astronomer has not fired HR head Cabot while CEO Byron resigned
content: Following a 'Kiss Cam' incident at a Coldplay concert, Astronomer CEO Andy Byron resigned, but HR head Kristin Cabot remains on leave, raising questions about her employment status. Legal and corporate considerations, including internal policies and potential legal risks, may be influencing the company's decision. Severance negotiations or Cabot's own account of events could also be factors.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for July 22 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying DLF and Bajaj FinServ. DLF, exhibiting a flag pattern, is expected to break out upwards, targeting 880 with a stop loss at 838. Bajaj FinServ, having broken out of a triangle pattern, aims for 2135, supported by positive momentum and a stop loss at 2017.

title: 'Saiyaara' crosses Rs 100 crore mark; sees minor dip on first Monday
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama, 'Saiyaara,' starring debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has remarkably grossed over Rs 100 crore in just four days. Defying expectations, the film has become a sleeper hit of 2025, setting a new benchmark for films featuring debutant actors. Its emotional narrative and strong performances have resonated with audiences and industry peers alike.

title: ‘Extreme lack of effort’: Hillary Clinton email row back in spotlight
content: Senator Chuck Grassley released declassified documents revealing the FBI's allegedly inadequate investigation into Hillary Clinton's email server. Grassley claims the FBI, under Comey, showed a lack of due diligence and contrasted this with the Trump-Russia probe. The documents suggest potential interference by the Obama administration and raise questions about the handling of classified information.

title: 'Why would I': Hunter Biden denies bringing cocaine to White House
content: Hunter Biden denied any involvement with the cocaine found at the White House in 2023, during an interview Monday He stated he has been sober since 2019. The FBI recently reopened the case and President Donald Trump too insinuated without any evidence that the cocaine pouch was either from Joe Biden and Hunter.

title: Why cardiac arrests are striking young adults?
content: Cardiac arrests are increasing among young adults. Previously rare, these events now affect seemingly healthy individuals. Underlying heart conditions, lifestyle choices, and even COVID-19 may contribute. Early detection and prevention are crucial. Awareness of symptoms like chest pain and shortness of breath is important. Regular check-ups, healthy habits, and stress management can reduce risk.

title: Blackhawks may settle legal dispute tied to Connor Bedard’s top-line teammate
content: As the Chicago Blackhawks gear up for the 2025-26 season, optimism is tempered by a contract dispute with Arvid Soderblom. While focusing on developing their young core, led by Connor Bedard, the Blackhawks face uncertainty in their goaltending situation. The team is proactively building depth with signings like Stanislav Berezhnoy, ensuring they are prepared for all eventualities.

title: 2 sixes and OUT! Vaibhav Suryavanshi fails to fire again
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the aggressive left-handed opener, grabbed attention again in the second Youth Test against England U-19 with a quickfire 20 off 14 balls. This followed his impressive performance in the first match, where he scored a half-century and took two wickets. England U-19 posted 309, led by Ekansh Singh's century. Suryavanshi aims to contribute significantly in the second innings.

title: Air India got 9 showcauses in 6 months for safety violations: Minister
content: Air India received nine show-cause notices for safety violations, with one enforcement action completed, according to Union minister Murlidhar Mohol. While a Dreamliner crash occurred, no adverse reliability trends were reported. The government acknowledged staff shortages in key aviation agencies like DGCA, BCAS, and AAI, but stated that operations haven't been impacted, and recruitment efforts are ongoing to address the shortfall.

title: Stunning stat! India batters trail behind one man - England's Dawson
content: England has replaced injured Shoaib Bashir with Liam Dawson for the fourth Test against India at Old Trafford. Bashir suffered a finger fracture during the third Test, paving the way for Dawson's return after last playing a Test in 2017. England leads the series 2-1, with Dawson bringing valuable experience with both bat and ball to the team.

title: Udaipur Files: I&B panel OKs the movie; no Supreme Court nod yet
content: The I&B ministry's committee has cleared 'Udaipur Files: Kanhaiya Lal Tailor Murder' for release with modifications, including a new disclaimer and name changes, after ordering additional cuts beyond the CBFC's initial 55. However, the Supreme Court has temporarily halted the film's theatrical release, pending a hearing on Thursday to address petitioners' objections to the committee's order.

title: India, Pak continue shadow boxing with Notams along borders for air exercises
content: Following recent cross-border hostilities, India and Pakistan continue strategic posturing by issuing Notams to reserve airspace for exercises. The IAF plans air combat drills near the border from July 23-25, while Pakistan has issued Notams for its central and southern regions, reflecting ongoing tensions after the May conflict triggered by India's strikes on terror hubs.

title: Bihar 1st in country to get a cap of 1,200 voters per booth
content: Bihar is leading the way in electoral reform. The state has reduced the number of voters per polling station to 1,200. This change has increased the number of polling stations by 12,817. The Election Commission will implement this cap across India. The move aims to reduce long queues on polling day.

title: 'Total disaster': Trump slams Obama appointed judge in Harvard case hearing
content: Donald Trump has attacked a federal judge overseeing a legal dispute between his administration and Harvard University, alleging bias and promising to appeal any unfavorable ruling. He accused the judge, an Obama appointee, of being a "disaster" and claimed Harvard is anti-Semitic and anti-American despite its vast wealth.

title: PM: Celebrate ‘Sindoor’ success; oppn demands prompt discussion
content: PM Modi declared India's retaliation against terrorist camps inside Pakistan a complete success, amidst opposition demands for discussions on "Operation Sindoor" and the Pahalgam attack. The government agreed to a 16-hour debate next week. Congress criticized the delay in scheduling the Pahalgam discussion and demanded PM's response to Trump's claim regarding Operation Sindoor.

title: Paulina Gretzky’s Hollywood dreams, huge net worth show her own star
content: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of NHL legend Wayne Gretzky, has carved her own path with a $5 million net worth. Initially aiming for ballet, she transitioned to modeling and acting, appearing in movies like 'Fame' and 'Grown Ups 2'. She also explored singing, releasing her song 'Collecting Dust', and is now a social media influencer.

title: Dwyane Wade shows peaceful retreat after Kaavia’s ‘country girl’ moment
content: Dwyane Wade shares glimpses of his family moments. He posts videos of daughter Kaavia with a pony. Gabrielle Union is also seen in the video. Wade also shares a serene sea view from his vacation home. He emphasizes the importance of freedom for Kaavia. Wade and Union foster compassion and individuality in their parenting.

title: Travis Kelce goes solo in LA as Taylor Swift faces family emergency
content: Pop singer Taylor Swift is helping her father, Scott Swift, recover after heart surgery. Her partner, Travis Kelce, was seen driving in Los Angeles. Kelce is supporting Swift and her family during this time. He is also preparing for Kansas City Chiefs training camp. Kelce and his brother are pausing their podcast.

title: Trump backs possible UFC fight as Michael Chandler targets White House battle with McGregor
content: UFC star Michael Chandler has expressed his eagerness to fight Conor McGregor at the White House on July 4, 2026, coinciding with America's 250th Independence Day. Chandler emphasized his desire to settle their unfinished rivalry from The Ultimate Fighter 31. McGregor, who recently hinted at a comeback and re-entered the UFC drug-testing pool, is yet to respond.

title: Josh Allen reveals new wellness routine with wife Hailee Steinfeld ahead of 2025 NFL training camp
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen and his wife, Hailee Steinfeld, have incorporated an infrared sauna with red light therapy into their daily routine to enhance workouts and recovery. Allen maintains a comprehensive wellness plan, prioritizing sleep, a clean diet, regular workouts, and golf. This balanced approach aims to achieve peak physical condition during the offseason.

title: Protein powders and liver health: Should you really be scooping daily?
content: Protein is vital for various bodily functions, with recommended intake varying based on activity levels. While protein supplements can be safe for meeting requirements, concerns exist regarding added sugars, artificial ingredients, and potential contaminants. Prioritizing whole food sources and consulting healthcare experts is crucial, especially for individuals with pre-existing health conditions, to ensure safe and effective protein consumption.

title: Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift reportedly share homes across US
content: Amidst their demanding careers, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce prioritize staying connected. Nashville has emerged as their central hub, strategically chosen for its proximity to Kansas City and Swift's family. They navigate their relationship by splitting time between Kelce's mansion, hotels, and Swift's residences, utilizing her private jet to bridge the distance.

title: Tariff deadline Aug 1, US team to visit India in 2nd half of month
content: Despite Trump's August 1st deadline, US negotiators will visit India later in August, aiming for a bilateral trade agreement by Fall. Sticking points remain, particularly regarding American agricultural and dairy access, which India resists. India seeks gains in textiles, footwear, and auto parts. Trump's insistence on agricultural concessions and opaque deal-making with other nations are also concerns.

title: Probe agencies can’t summon lawyers: AG; CJI says 'ED officers crossing all limits'
content: The Enforcement Directorate admitted its mistake in summoning advocates. Attorney General informed the Supreme Court that probe agencies received instructions to avoid such errors. The Chief Justice of India emphasized the privileged nature of lawyer-client communication. The Supreme Court will address petitions from bar associations on July 29.

title: Cash-at-home row: Justice Varma removal notices handed; LS may initiate
content: Parliament receives notices to remove Allahabad HC's Justice Yashwant Varma. Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members submit the notices citing alleged misconduct. A committee will investigate the charges. Lok Sabha Speaker and Rajya Sabha Chairman will form the committee. This marks the second time in 32 years that a judge's removal motion is brought before the House.

title: ED summons Meta, Google on July 28 for ads on betting sites
content: Meta and Google, under ED investigation for hosting ads of illegal betting sites, have been granted an extension until July 28 to appear before the agency. They requested more time to gather documents related to the probe into betting sites that allegedly defrauded Indian citizens of crores.

title: AAIB AI 171 crash probe totally unbiased: Naidu; final report awaited
content: Union Minister Ram Mohan Naidu addressed the Rajya Sabha about the Air India plane crash investigation. He stated that the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau follows a rule-based process. The AAIB is unbiased in its probe. Data from the plane's black boxes has been successfully decoded in India for the first time. The preliminary report is out.

title: 2006 Mumbai train blasts: HC rubbishes reliability of prosecution witnesses
content: The Bombay High Court has cast serious doubt on the reliability of prosecution witnesses in the 11/7 train blasts case. The court highlighted the lack of authority of the special executive officer who conducted the test identification parade, a critical step after the accused's arrest. Consequently, the identification of three alleged planters was deemed invalid, significantly weakening the prosecution's case.

title: Shannon Sharpe under fire as his accuser retires from OnlyFans after settlement
content: NFL legend Shannon Sharpe has reached a settlement with a 20-year-old former OnlyFans model who accused him of repeated sexual assault, leading to significant backlash from fans. The woman's lawyer stated that both sides acknowledged a long-term, consensual relationship and that all matters have been resolved satisfactorily. Sharpe has remained silent amidst the controversy.

title: 15-yr-old alleges rape by hockey coaches in Odisha, 4 held
content: In Odisha's Jajpur district, police have detained four hockey coaches following allegations of gang rape by a 15-year-old trainee. The survivor's FIR states the assault occurred on July 3 after a coaching session, where the accused allegedly took her to a lodge.

title: Tension and fury over Jaipur murder, key NH blocked
content: A 22-year-old Vipin Kumar was fatally stabbed near Jaipur. The alleged attacker Mohammad Anas and his aides are in custody. The incident triggered communal tension and protests. Anas, a history-sheeter, has several criminal cases against him. Police are investigating the motive behind the murder. Anas was shot in the leg during his arrest.

title: Something wrong on campus, says SC, puts lens on suicides
content: The Supreme Court is worried about rising student suicides. It asked IIT-Kharagpur and Sharda University for reports after two recent deaths. The court wants to know about FIR filings and university actions. It is reviewing a previous order to form a task force to prevent suicides. The task force is delayed due to logistical issues.

title: 20L formal job additions reported in May; surge spans gender, sectors & regions: EPFO
content: India's organised sector experienced unprecedented growth in May, adding over 20 lakh net payrolls, the highest since April 2018. This surge, which is driven by youth and women, reflects the formalisation of the workforce across various sectors and regions. Maharashtra led regional contributions, signalling enhanced job confidence and workforce fluidity, highlighting the need for sustained skill development and social protection.

title: Congress says ‘far deeper reasons’ behind Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar’s resignation
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that Mr. Dhankhar was not personally informed about Union Ministers J.P. Nadda and Kiren Rijiju not attending the second Business Advisory Committee meeting at 4.30 p.m. on Monday (July 21, 2025)

title: Four killed, several injured in auto collision near Kanamarlapudi in Andhra Pradesh
content: The deceased have been identified as: Brahmayya Battula, 32, Anjamma Battula, 32, Nagamarthamma Battula, 40, and Muthyallamma Battula, 60, all hailing from Karumanchi village.

title: What is the legal status of right to vote? | Explained
content: What is the difference between a constitutional right and a statutory right? What does Section 62 of the Representation of the People Act, 1951 provide? What did Justice Ajay Rastogi state in his partial dissent in the Anoop Baranwal case?

title: Earthquake hits Faridabad, tremors felt in Delhi-NCR
content: The National Centre for Seismology said an earthquake of 3.2 magnitude was recorded at 6 a.m., with Faridabad as its epicentre; tremors were felt in Delhi, NCR but no reports of any damage

title: BITS-Hyderabad startup delivers indigenous combat drones to Indian Army
content: The startup, born at BITS Pilani Hyderabad campus and run by Jayant Khatri and Sourya Choudhury, delivered the units within two months of beginning operations, according to an official disclosure

title: Jangaon schools to follow U-shape seating for inclusive learning
content: “This initiative represents a powerful shift, not just in furniture layout, but in educational philosophy. In Jangaon’s classrooms today, every child matters,” Jangaon District Collector Rizwan Basha Shaik said

title: India’s water, energy demand spotlight risk of human-induced quakes
content: When groundwater is pumped out, the mass of water maintaining the pressure under the earth is removed, creating jolts on the surface

title: CPI(M) West Bengal State secretary Md. Salim slams Mamata for ‘waking up late’ to Bengali identity issue
content: The Left leader says BJP, RSS have long targeted regional identities for years; calls Mamata’s language movement a poll gimmick

title: Revision of Bihar poll rolls riddled with violations, should be cancelled: Jean Drèze
content: In multiple instances, voters discovered that their forms had already been submitted by the BLO. Even their signatures on the forms were not taken; illiterate voters reported having to pay someone to fill out the form

title: ‘Innovations, creativity among youth key factors to promote climate action’
content: “An environmentally sustainable economy could be evolved with proper resource management, collaborations and upskilling”

title: Congress-AAP lock horns over land pooling scheme in Punjab
content: Leader of Opposition, Congress’s Partap Singh Bajwa, addressing the demonstrators, alleged that the AAP’s land pooling policy is nothing but an outright attempt to rob Punjab’s agricultural land

title: V.S. Achuthanandan’s body shifted from AKG centre to son’s private residence
content: Achuthanandan’s family will keep an overnight vigil until Tuesday (July 22, 2025) morning, when party workers will shift his body to lie in state at the Durbar Hall at 8:30 a.m.

title: Hindus in Assam will become a minority in 10 years: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: The Chief Minister said the State government has reclaimed 1.29 lakh bighas of land from squatters so far

title: Opposition demands answers from PM in Rajya Sabha, stages a walkout
content: Speaking on the issue Congress president and Leader of the Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge said that terrorists who carried out the Pahalgam attack have neither been caught nor killed till date; he also said that U.S. President Donald Trump’s claims on ceasefire during Operation Sindoor were humiliating for the country

title: Polls to elect next Vice-President to be held as soon as possible: Constitution
content: The person elected to fill the vacancy will be entitled to hold office "for the full term of five years from the date on which he enters upon his office"

title: 610 antiquities retrieved from six countries including U.S. during 2020-24: Govt
content: The total number spanning the six countries— the U.S., the U.K., Australia, Canada, Italy and Thailand— for 2020-24 stands at 610

title: Bird-hit incidents at Hyderabad airport lower than in major Indian cities
content: In contrast, Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International Airport reported the highest number, with a total of 695 bird strikes in the same period

title: Tamil Nadu to set up hornbill conservation centre at Anamalai Tiger Reserve
content: An official release said hornbills, often known as “farmers of the forest”, play a crucial ecological role as seed dispersers, helping regenerate native forests

title: Action plan launched to curb pollution in Kadambrayar, says Environment dept.
content: The action plan was formulated by the district-level technical committee comprising representatives from the Irrigation dept., PCB, and the Departments of Industries and Local Self Governments, along with the District Collector

title: Keeladi report under review, Union Ministry of Culture tells Lok Sabha
content: Union Minister for Culture Gajendra Singh Shekhawat says comments of experts have been shared with the lead archaeologist, which are still to be finalised

title: STP projects to check pollution of Vembanad Lake hit by hurdles
content: Implementation stalls despite tribunal pressure, with key treatment projects in Kochi lagging due to rain-related delays, design clearances, and infrastructure setbacks

title: ED secures conviction in money-laundering case involving NALCO CMD and others
content: Among those arraigned in the case were Mr. Srivastava’s wife Chandni Srivastava, Bhushan Lai Bajaj, and his wife Anita Bajaj

title: Desilting and Restoration of Chilavannoor, Market canals to begin shortly
content: Project under Integrated Urban Regeneration and Water Transport System to be executed using ₹28.77 crore allotted by KIIFB

title: People of Tamil Nadu expect only single-party rule in 2026, says Edappadi Palaniswami
content: AIADMK general secretary downplays BJP’s pre-poll assertion about forming a coalition government; says his appeal to all like-minded parties to join hands with AIADMK to defeat DMK applied for Vijay’s Tamizhaga Vettri Kazhagam and Seeman’s Naam Tamilar Katchi; accuses Chief Minister M.K. Stalin of not understanding sufferings of people

title: Committee condoles death of ‘key figure behind Moolampilly Rehabilitation Package’
content: The condolence note recalls how V.S. Achuthanandan reversed course after initially criticising the protest, ultimately shaping a landmark rehabilitation package through dialogue and policy action

title: BJP set ‘honeytraps’ to bring down MVA government, alleges Sanjay Raut
content: The police were conducting raids to find four pen drives and two CDs having sensitive footage involving sitting legislators, all of which eventually linked to Praful Lodha, the Shiv Sena (UBT) leader said

title: Ashim Kumar Ghosh sworn in as Haryana Governor
content: Mr. Ghosh, a distinguished academician and experienced political leader, served as the Head of the Department of Political Science at a reputed college in Kolkata in West Bengal for nearly four decades

title: V.S. Achuthanandan helped transform socio-economic, political landscape of Kerala, says Antony
content: VS’ life and struggles and the torture he endured in the vanguard of the communist agitations for bonded agriculture workers in Kuttanad are unequalled and historical, says the senior Congress leader, reminiscing about listening to the communist leader’s speeches in Cherthala as a school student

title: Exclusion from rolls under SIR won’t affect citizenship, Election Commission tells Supreme Court
content: The electoral body was responding to allegations raised by petitioners that SIR was ‘citizenship screening’ and would lead to mass disenfranchisement

title: ‘Madhya Pradesh elections could be stolen, just as in Maharashtra’: Rahul Gandhi
content: In Maharashtra during the Lok Sabha polls, the Congress and our coalition swept the elections and four months after that, the BJP sweeps

title: Thiruvananthapuram witnesses an outpouring of emotions as a dear leader departs
content: Crowd filled the entire breadth of the road that leads from the Kerala University to the General Hospital as his mortal remains were brought to the old AKG centre. Slogans in his praise rent the air for long, a testimony to the immense affinity the people had towards the man

title: Dhankhar's resignation 'totally unexpected', more to it than meets the eye: Congress
content: In his resignation letter to President Droupadi Murmu Jagdeep Dhankhar said he was stepping down with immediate effect

title: 35-yr-old killed in Gujarat for objecting to rash driving
content: Anjana Singh’s traditional look is perfect inspiration for festive celebrations in India 10 green sarees worn by Bollywood beauties which are perfect for Hariyali Teej 2025 Stunning snaps of Manasi Parekh you can't miss 10 Baby names inspired by light and radiance Happy Birthday Ernest Hemingway: 10 quotes from his books that are perfect life lessons Top 10 gardening errors to watch out for Rashi Singh outfits that are perfect style goals 10 things to know before getting a pet Indian Ringneck Parrot Raashi Khanna’s skincare routine Saree tales by actress Anumol

title: Any move to curtail trade union rights will be opposed: BMS
content: Hiranmay Pandya, the president of the RSS-affiliated trade union, says the organisation is open to work with other trade unions too on the issue of their rights

title: C.Ve. Shanmugam files petition against use of CM’s name in scheme
content: Says, public money cannot be used to glorify political personalities especially when the elections are nearing

title: Election Commission opposes AIADMK’s plea for time limit to decide on representations
content: Says, “an order requiring specific timelines is not necessary” since it is a constitutional body whose workload due to upcoming Bihar elections must be factored in

title: DMK restrained from OTP verification for its ‘Oraniyil Tamil Nadu’ campaign
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras HC says interim injunction is granted to the limited extent till the issue of right to privacy is examined, since the fundamental rights of people are at stake

title: 190 out of 410 DGCA vacancies to be filled this year, says Minister for Civil Aviation Ram Mohan Naidu
content: A senior official of the DGCA said that appointments were likely by October, and the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) had already carried out interviews for Class 1 officers

title: Odisha ‘sexual harassment’ case: internal complaints committee report had not recommended any punitive action
content: The report of the Internal Complaints Committee at F.M. Autonomous College in Balasore, which came out recently, contradicts the statements of several ICC members who said that they had recommended the removal of the accused teacher from his post as the head of the education department

title: It’s my right as the Leader of the Opposition, but never allowed to speak in the House, says Rahul Gandhi
content: The Lok Sabha witnessed an uproar over the Opposition’s demand for a discussion on Operation Sindoor, and the Pahalgam terror attack, on the first day of the Monsoon Session

title: India, South Korea hold 13th high-level Coast Guard meeting in Delhi
content: Discussions were held on strengthening operational cooperation in key areas, including maritime search and rescue, pollution response, and maritime law enforcement

title: Mehbooba urges Rahul to raise issue of ‘Muslim victimisation’ in Parliament
content: The PDP chief highlights cases emerging from Assam and the ongoing survey in Bihar. “It appears to be another effort to dispossess, disempower, and disenfranchise Muslims,” she says, and urges Mr. Gandhi to protect the ‘secular legacy’ of the Congress, ‘which Muslims trusted when they chose India during Partition’

title: We will make BJP chant ‘Joy Bangla’ after 2026: Abhishek Banerjee at Trinamool Martyr’s Day rally
content: “Why is BJP so irritated if someone speaks Bengali? Is it because they couldn’t win in Bengal?” asks TMC’s second-in-command

title: Centre seeks inputs from States, central ministries on 8th Pay Commission
content: The Chairperson and members for the 8th Pay Commission will be appointed once the 8th CPC is notified by the government, Mr. Chaudhary said in a written reply to the Lok Sabha

title: J&K police constable to receive ₹50 lakh for torture in custody; CBI to conduct probe
content: The court said the narrative of the case revealed a “disturbing pattern of systematic cover-up and abuse of authority that further strengthens the appellant’s claim for CBI investigation.”

title: Farmer groups to step up campaign against FTA with U.S.
content: The SKM will observe August 13 as ‘Corporations Quit India Day’; the SKM said that the general body has called for nationwide protests against the deal as it could act against the interests of farmers

title: Mamata accuses Modi Govt of being ‘controlled’ by U.S. President
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister also said that Mr. Modi could not even take Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK) during Operation Sindoor in which so much blood was shed

title: NISAR, first joint satellite of NASA and ISRO, scheduled to be launched on July 30
content: The first joint satellite of the Indian and U.S. space agencies, NISAR, weighing 2,392 kg, will also be the first satellite to observe Earth with a dual frequency Synthetic Aperture Radar — NASA’s L-band and ISRO’s S-band

title: DGCA found five safety violations by Air India in the past six months: govt.
content: The total warnings issued to Air India by DGCA in the first seven months of 2025 were down to 65 from 203 in 2024

title: CAG flags lapses worth ₹573 crore in Indian Railways
content: Up to 25 audit observations by the CAG point to shortfall in recovery of revenue and lapses in project execution across railway zones

title: ‘Liquor scam’ charge sheet alleges ₹3,500 cr. kickbacks, hawala deals in India, abroad to route money
content: A syndicate of political leaders and officials gave purchase orders to the companies which agreed to their demand to pay commissions, suppressed the regular and popular brands, promoted new liquor brands, opened government retail outlets, and maintained a manual system as per their convenience to collect huge amounts, says SIT

title: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar submits his resignation to President
content: The 14th Vice-President of India leaves office with two years left in his term; decision comes on the first day of Monsoon Session of Parliament; stepping down to abide by medical advice, he says

title: CBSE instructs all affiliated schools to install CCTV cameras at key points to ensure student safety
content: As per new rule, CCTVs must be installed in all key areas of school campuses, including entry and exit points, lobbies, corridors, staircases, classrooms, laboratories, libraries, canteen, store rooms, playgrounds, and other common areas

title: EPFO claims net addition of 20.06 lakh members in May
content: Around 9.42 lakh are first-time subscribers, which is an increase of 11.04% over April 2025. Of these new subscribers, 5.6 lakh (59.48%) are in the age group of 18-25

title: EPFO disposed of over 98.5% applications for pension on higher wages: government
content: 4,00,573 demand letters were issued to applicants eligible for PoHW and 11,01,582 were rejected, while 21,995 are pending

title: DMK government not showing interest in river linking project, says ex-CM
content: When he was in power, he had convinced Andhra Pradesh and Telangana governments to support the Cauvery-Godavari linking project, says Edappadi K. Palaniswami

title: People evicted in Assam may move to Nagaland, warns students’ body
content: The Western Sümi Students’ Union said the evictions in Assam pose a threat to the security of the residents of Nagaland

title: V.S. Achuthanandan was a diligent worker till the end, helming the Administrative Reforms Commission
content: Under his stewardship, the commission came out with 14 detailed reports in five years — averaging nearly three a year — on a wide range of topics. The 14th report dealt with the commission’s own performance

title: GST notice: State and Centre have to agree on reprieve for small traders
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar has claimed that the number of notices could be about 14,000, and said that the State would write to the Centre to withdraw notices, and has blamed the BJP for the current problem

title: Pinarayi remembers V.S. Achuthanandan as a strong-willed leader with legacy of fighting injustice
content: Pinarayi Vijayan said the centenarian communist dedicated his life to the people and that his life remained intertwined with the history and formation of modern Kerala.

title: Two more arrested in rowdy sheeter murder case
content: Another suspect, identified as R.D. Anil, reportedly a relative of BJP MLA Byrathi Basavaraj, who was named as accused number five in the case is taken into custody for questioning

title: IAF to conduct major exercise in Rajasthan from July 23; NOTAM issued
content: According to sources, the Indian Air Force is set to carry out a major military exercise in Rajasthan, covering areas from Barmer to Jodhpur

title: Parliamentary proceedings: A thriving democracy cannot sustain constant acrimony, says Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: The Rajya Sabha Chairman, in his opening remarks on the first day of the Monsoon Session of Parliament, urged political parties to foster bonhomie and mutual respect

title: IndiGo flight with 140 passengers on board makes emergency landing at Indore airport
content: An IndiGo spokesperson stated that flight 6E 813 operating from Goa International Airport (Dabolim) to Indore reported a technical snag just before landing

title: Andhra Pradesh experiences significant rainfall, leading to a drop in temperatures and improvement in monsoon deficit
content: Heavy showers cool the State and help reduce monsoon shortfall; IMD warns of continued rainfall till July 27

title: Three of inter-State gang arrested, gold worth ₹2.10 crore and ₹4.8 lakh in cash recovered
content: Police achieve a major breakthrough in the robbery reported from a goldsmith shop in the thickly populated Saraf Bazaar area in Kalaburagi

title: GO 49 to create new tiger conservation reserve kept in abeyance over Adivasi concerns
content: The State government’s decision comes in the wake of concerns raised by tribals and public representatives across tribal areas and detailed discussions held with various stakeholders

title: Prepare to be unseated in 2026, Suvendhu tells Mamata; parties ramp up rhetoric
content: The BJP legislator also reiterated the party’s demand for a special intensive revision of West Bengal’s electoral roll, along the lines of the exercise in Bihar, to ‘weed out foreign infiltrators’

title: Which NFL teams have the best -- and worst -- rosters? Let's stack all 32 projected lineups
content: We ranked every roster ahead of the season, then picked strengths, weaknesses, X factors and underrated players to know.

title: D.C. mayor 'focused' on RFK deal, not Trump talk
content: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser remains confident that the Commanders will return to the city but steered clear of President Donald Trump's threats to scuttle a stadium deal if the team does not return to its former name.

title: Ex-NFLPA boss resigns role at equity firm Carlyle
content: Former NFL Players Association executive director Lloyd Howell Jr. resigned his part-time consulting job with The Carlyle Group, one of a select group of league-approved firms seeking minority ownership in NFL franchises.

title: Injured Lillard glad to be 'back home' with Blazers
content: Damian Lillard spoke at a news conference on Monday evening, saying it's meaningful to return to the city where he's spent most of his adult life.

title: Phillies win on catcher's interference call in 10th
content: Brandon Marsh scored on a catcher's interference call with the bases loaded in the 10th inning to give the Phillies a 3-2 walk-off win over the Red Sox.

title: Cowboys' Parsons reports amid unsettled deal
content: Micah Parsons reported to training camp in Oxnard, California, on Monday, but what's not clear is whether Parsons will take part in practice when the Cowboys begin workouts Tuesday as he awaits a long-term extension.

title: Bengals prez: 'Foolishness' Stewart still unsigned
content: Bengals team president Mike Brown didn't mince words about the contract situation between the team and unsigned rookie Shemar Stewart.

title: Source: Hines to Bolts after 2 years out injured
content: Running back Nyheim Hines, who hasn't played in the NFL the past two seasons because of a knee injury, reached agreement on a contract with the Chargers, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Public's help sought in Ole Miss player's shooting
content: Authorities on Monday asked for the public to provide surveillance footage and details from eyewitnesses as they investigate the fatal shooting of an Ole Miss freshman football player in a Memphis neighborhood after a pool party.

title: 😂 McDavid, Draisaitl play in beer league game
content: The Edmonton Oilers stars, not exactly playing at top intensity, suited up at Magna Centre in Newmarket, Ontario for a Wednesday pickup game.

title: Updated ranking of MLB's top 50 trade deadline candidates: A new No. 1 and best landing spots
content: A red-hot slugger on the move? An All-Star outfielder available? Our running list of who could be traded by the deadline has new names at the top.

title: Randle-Towns trade, Bridges to New York, Sixers add George: Regrading 2024 offseason moves
content: NBA expert Kevin Pelton looks back at 10 of the biggest trade and free agency moves and regrades them.

title: Does signing Emma Meesseman make the Liberty the 2025 WNBA title favorites?
content: The Lynx have been the 2025 front-runners, but Meesseman's return to the WNBA could tip the scales for New York.

title: Petitti letter: Michigan sign-stealing penalties have gone far enough
content: Despite charges of serious NCAA rule violations, commissioner indicates sanctions have run their course

title: Scottie Scheffler's unique dominance over golf continues at Open Championship
content: Scheffler's march on Royal Portrush was a masterclass and proof that his approach is unlike anyone else's.

title: England's semifinal record is the result of hard work and unity
content: England are in their sixth major semifinal in 10 years, but it's no accident. The togetherness of the squad has made it happen.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Philadelphia jumps Miami into first place
content: El Trafico may have been the game of the weekend, but the Philadelphia Union are the team to beat according to ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

content: Make of them what you will, but here are the stats from last season that you should be aware of as you prepare for your drafts.

content: Atlanta's and Cincinnati's threads are largely unchanged, other than neat details that pay homage to the game.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including the CP3-Clippers reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Waiver wire: Maya Caldwell stepping up for Dream
content: Maya Caldwell is making the most of her increased opportunity with Rhyne Howard hurt for the Atlanta Dream and leads the list of fantasy pickups.

title: How Hugo Ekitike ended up at Liverpool, and what they're getting
content: There is belief among Liverpool's decision-makers that Hugo Ekitike, 23, has all the tools to develop into one of Europe's top strikers. How did Liverpool decide to sign him and what can fans expect?

title: Man United confirm $94M Bryan Mbeumo signing
content: Manchester United announced the signing of forward Bryan Mbeumo from Brentford for a transfer fee sources told ESPN was worth in excess of £70m.

title: Sources: Man United to leave quartet off U.S. tour
content: Manchester United are set to axe Alejandro Garnacho, Antony, Tyrell Malacia and Jadon Sancho from their squad for the preseason tour of America, sources have told ESPN.

title: Source: Díaz wants to leave Liverpool  for Bayern
content: Luis Díaz remains determined to leave Liverpool this summer and hopes Bayern Munich will make a new offer to sign him, a source has told ESPN.

title: Sources: Liverpool finalising $106m Ekitike deal
content: Liverpool are finalising a move for Hugo Ekitike after they agreed a deal worth up to £79 million ($91m) with Eintracht Frankfurt, sources have told ESPN.

title: Arteta '100%' backs Arsenal's Partey protocols
content: Mikel Arteta has said he "100%" believes Arsenal followed the correct protocols regarding Thomas Partey's time at the club after the midfielder was charged with five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

title: Italy striker Retegui leaves Atalanta for Saudi side
content: Italian striker Mateo Retegui has joined Saudi Pro League side Al-Qadsiah from Atalanta, both clubs said on Monday, with Italian media reports saying last season's Serie A top scorer has signed a four-year contract.

title: Source: City to eye Burnley GK Trafford
content: Manchester City will consider a move for Burnley's James Trafford if they decide to sign a goalkeeper this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: Stanway: Carter abusers not proper England fans
content: England midfielder Georgia Stanway said those who have sent racist abuse to Jess Carter are not proper fans of the Lionesses

title: Steelers unveil 1933-inspired throwback uniforms with yellow helmets and beige pants
content: Pittsburgh's new throwback look features bold chest stripes, a city crest patch and a rare yellow helmet.

title: UFC 318 fight grades: Did Poirier vs. Holloway live up to the hype?
content: Max Holloway vs. Dustin Poirier capped Saturday's pay-per-view, but did that matchup top ESPN's UFC 318 fight grades?

title: Waiver wire: Make some moves toward the Marlins
content: As the MLB season's second half gets into full swing, here are the players you should claim off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: From Kevin Durant's Team Durant to Carmelo Anthony's Team Melo, these next-gen AAU stars got next
content: NBA stars such as Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony sponsor their own high school AAU shoe-circuit teams.

content: Before these stars went to college basketball and the NBA, they showed their stuff at the Nike Peach Jam.

title: 3.2 magnitude earthquake strikes Haryana; epicentre in Faridabad - key details
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: "Children Ran, Bodies On Fire": Dhaka Crash Eyewitnesses Describe Horror
content: The Milestone School in Dhaka's Uttara neighbourhood was the site of a deadly fighter jet crash that left 19 dead on Monday morning.

title: Did FBI Ignore Key Evidence In Hillary Clinton Email Case? What Declassified Flies Say
content: The report comes days after US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard alleged that the Obama administration manufactured the 'hoax' around Donald Trump's Russia link.

title: Bangladesh School Jet Crash Death Count Rises To 25, Dozens Still Critical
content: A Bangladesh Air Force training aircraft crashed into a school in Dhaka, the country's capital, shortly after takeoff on Monday afternoon, killing the pilot and 24 other people, most of whom were students, officials said.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 2 Live Updates: Focus On Bihar Roll Revision Today
content: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 2 Live Updates: AAP Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh has already given a Suspension of Business notice in the Upper House, demanding a discussion on the Bihar electoral lists.

title: Tremors In Delhi As 3.2 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Haryana
content: Tremors were felt across Delhi-NCR on Tuesday morning. There were no reports of any loss of life or damage to property.

title: Pentagon Withdraws 700 Marines From Los Angeles
content: The Pentagon ordered the U.S. Marines to leave Los Angeles on Monday, more than a month after President Donald Trump deployed them to the city against the objections of local leaders.

title: On Camera, Delivery Agent Seen Urinating In Lift, Thrashed By Residents
content: A case has been filed against a Blinkit delivery agent for allegedly urinating in a building's lift in Mumbai's Virar West. The residents of the building discovered the incident after reviewing the CCTV footage.

title: IMF's Gita Gopinath To Step Down In August, Return to Harvard University
content: Gita Gopinath, the No 2 official at the International Monetary Fund, will leave her post at the end of August to return to Harvard University, the IMF said in a statement on Monday.

title: "19 Years For What Purpose?": Father Of Mumbai Blasts Victim On Court Verdict
content: Ramesh Naik, who lost his daughter in the 2006 Mumbai blasts, questioned the government following Bombay High Court's decision to acquit 12 accused of the incident.

title: WHO Says Staff Residence, Warehouse "Attacked" In Gaza By Israeli Forces
content: The World Health Organization said Monday its facilities in Gaza had come under Israeli attack, echoing calls from Western countries for an immediate ceasefire as Israel expanded military operations to the central city of Deir el-Balah.

title: Kremlin Signals Openness To Putin-Trump Talks In Beijing In September
content: Russia is open to discussing the possibility of holding talks between President Vladimir Putin and Trump, should the latter attend the upcoming commemorative events in Beijing this September, Kremlin spokesman said on Monday, according to RT.

title: White House Bans Wall Street Journal From Covering Trump Over Epstein Story
content: The White House on Monday barred The Wall Street Journal from traveling with Donald Trump during his upcoming visit to Scotland, after the newspaper reported that he wrote a bawdy birthday message to alleged sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Iran Says "Can't Give Up" Nuclear Program Despite "Serious Damage"
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi told Fox News that Tehran cannot not give up on its uranium enrichment program which was severely damaged during the Israel-Iran war last month.

title: US Releases Martin Luther King Jr. Assassination Files Despite Family's Opposition
content: The Trump administration released hundreds of thousands of pages of records on Monday about the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. despite concerns from the civil rights leader's family.

title: 'Cosby Show' Star Malcolm-Jamal Warner Dies By Drowning At 54
content: American actor Malcolm-Jamal Warner, who played Bill Cosby's son Theo on the 1980s groundbreaking television hit "The Cosby Show," died at age 54 on Monday by drowning, a law enforcement source confirmed to Reuters.

title: US Court Challenges Trump Administration On Harvard Funding Cuts
content: A federal judge on Monday challenged the Trump administration's reasons for slashing billions of dollars in federal funding to Harvard University, triggering a furious response from the president.

title: Ahead Of New Talks, Iran Blames Europeans For Nuclear Deal Collapse
content: Tehran blamed European powers on Monday for the failure of a landmark 2015 nuclear deal, accusing them of breaking commitments ahead of renewed talks in Istanbul with Britain, France and Germany.

title: Have To Remove Fake Voters: Poll Body To Top Court On Bihar Roll Revision
content: The Election Commission has denied the allegations of tweaking with the voter list in Bihar that multiple opposition parties have claimed in court.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar Resigns As Vice President, Says Will "Prioritise Health"
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar has resigned his post citing "medical advice". In a letter to President Droupadi Murmu, he said his resignation will be effective immediately.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar's Eventful Day In Parliament Before He Resigned As Vice President
content: In a sudden move, Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from his post on Monday evening to "prioritise health". He has sent his letter to President Droupadi Murmu, saying he is stepping down with immediate effect.
